1.verse: Jerusalem Cries over Her Loss - Jerusalem once was full of people, but now the city is empty. Jerusalem once was a great city among the nations, but now she is like a widow. She was like a queen of all the other cities, but now she is a slave.

2.verse: She cries loudly at night, and tears are on her cheeks. There is no one to comfort her; all who loved her are gone. All her friends have turned against her and are now her enemies.

3.verse: Judah has gone into captivity where she suffers and works hard. She lives among other nations, but she has found no rest. Those who chased her caught her when she was in trouble.

4.verse: The roads to Jerusalem are sad, because no one comes for the feasts. No one passes through her gates. Her priests groan, her young women are suffering, and Jerusalem suffers terribly.

5.verse: Her foes are now her masters. Her enemies enjoy the wealth they have taken. The LORD is punishing her for her many sins. Her children have gone away as captives of the enemy.

6.verse: The beauty of Jerusalem has gone away. Her rulers are like deer that cannot find food. They are weak and run from the hunters.

7.verse: Jerusalem is suffering and homeless. She remembers all the good things from the past. But her people were defeated by the enemy, and there was no one to help her. When her enemies saw her, they laughed to see her ruined.

8.verse: Jerusalem sinned terribly, so she has become unclean. Those who honored her now hate her, because they have seen her nakedness. She groans and turns away.

9.verse: She made herself dirty by her sins and did not think about what would happen to her. Her defeat was surprising, and no one could comfort her. She says, “LORD, see how I suffer, because the enemy has won.”

10.verse: The enemy reached out and took all her precious things. She even saw foreigners enter her Temple. The LORD had commanded foreigners never to enter the meeting place of his people.

11.verse: All of Jerusalem’s people groan, looking for bread. They are trading their precious things for food so they can stay alive. The city says, “Look, LORD, and see. I am hated.”

12.verse: Jerusalem says, “You who pass by on the road don’t seem to care. Come, look at me and see: Is there any pain like mine? Is there any pain like that he has caused me? The LORD has punished me on the day of his great anger.

13.verse: “He sent fire from above that went down into my bones. He stretched out a net for my feet and turned me back. He made me so sad and lonely that I am weak all day.

14.verse: “He has noticed my sins; they are tied together by his hands; they hang around my neck. He has turned my strength into weakness. The Lord has handed me over to those who are stronger than I.

15.verse: “The Lord has rejected all my mighty men inside my walls. He brought an army against me to destroy my young men. As if in a winepress, the Lord has crushed the capital city of Judah.

16.verse: “I cry about these things; my eyes overflow with tears. There is no one near to comfort me, no one who can give me strength again. My children are left sad and lonely, because the enemy has won.”

17.verse: Jerusalem reaches out her hands, but there is no one to comfort her. The LORD commanded the people of Jacob to be surrounded by their enemies. Jerusalem is now unclean like those around her.

18.verse: Jerusalem says, “The LORD is right, but I refused to obey him. Listen, all you people, and look at my pain. My young women and men have gone into captivity.

19.verse: “I called out to my friends, but they turned against me. My priests and my elders have died in the city while looking for food to stay alive.

20.verse: “Look at me, LORD. I am upset and greatly troubled. My heart is troubled, because I have been so stubborn. Out in the streets, the sword kills; inside the houses, death destroys.

21.verse: “People have heard my groaning, and there is no one to comfort me. All my enemies have heard of my trouble, and they are happy you have done this to me. Now bring that day you have announced so that my enemies will be like me.

22.verse: “Look at all their evil. Do to them what you have done to me because of all my sins. I groan over and over again, and I am afraid.”

1.verse: The Lord Destroyed Jerusalem - Look how the Lord in his anger has brought Jerusalem to shame. He has thrown down the greatness of Israel from the sky to the earth; he did not remember the Temple, his footstool, on the day of his anger.

2.verse: The Lord swallowed up without mercy all the houses of the people of Jacob; in his anger he pulled down the strong places of Judah. He threw her kingdom and its rulers down to the ground in dishonor.

3.verse: In his anger he has removed all the strength of Israel; he took away his power from Israel when the enemy came. He burned against the people of Jacob like a flaming fire that burns up everything around it.

4.verse: Like an enemy, he prepared to shoot his bow, and his hand was against us. Like an enemy, he killed all the good-looking people; he poured out his anger like fire on the tents of Jerusalem.

5.verse: The Lord was like an enemy; he swallowed up Israel. He swallowed up all her palaces and destroyed all her strongholds. He has caused more moaning and groaning for Judah.

6.verse: He cut down his Temple like a garden; he destroyed the meeting place. The LORD has made Jerusalem forget the set feasts and Sabbath days. He has rejected the king and the priest in his great anger.

7.verse: The Lord has rejected his altar and abandoned his Temple. He has handed over to the enemy the walls of Jerusalem’s palaces. Their uproar in the LORD’s Temple was like that of a feast day.

8.verse: The LORD planned to destroy the wall around Jerusalem. He measured the wall and did not stop himself from destroying it. He made the walls and defenses sad; together they have fallen.

9.verse: Jerusalem’s gates have fallen to the ground; he destroyed and smashed the bars of the gates. Her king and her princes are among the nations. The teaching of the LORD has stopped, and the prophets do not have visions from the LORD.

10.verse: The elders of Jerusalem sit on the ground in silence. They throw dust on their heads and put on rough cloth to show their sadness. The young women of Jerusalem bow their heads to the ground in sorrow.

11.verse: My eyes have no more tears, and I am sick to my stomach. I feel empty inside, because my people have been destroyed. Children and babies are fainting in the streets of the city.

12.verse: They ask their mothers, “Where is the grain and wine?” They faint like wounded soldiers in the streets of the city and die in their mothers’ arms.

13.verse: What can I say about you, Jerusalem? What can I compare you to? What can I say you are like? How can I comfort you, Jerusalem? Your ruin is as deep as the sea. No one can heal you.

14.verse: Your prophets saw visions, but they were false and worth nothing. They did not point out your sins to keep you from being captured. They preached what was false and led you wrongly.

15.verse: All who pass by on the road clap their hands at you; they make fun of Jerusalem and shake their heads. They ask, “Is this the city that people called the most beautiful city, the happiest place on earth?”

16.verse: All your enemies open their mouths to speak against you. They make fun and grind their teeth in anger. They say, “We have swallowed you up. This is the day we were waiting for! We have finally seen it happen.”

17.verse: The LORD has done what he planned; he has kept his word that he commanded long ago. He has destroyed without mercy, and he has let your enemies laugh at you. He has strengthened your enemies.

18.verse: The people cry out to the Lord. Wall of Jerusalem, let your tears flow like a river day and night. Do not stop or let your eyes rest.

19.verse: Get up, cry out in the night, even as the night begins. Pour out your heart like water in prayer to the Lord. Lift up your hands in prayer to him for the life of your children who are fainting with hunger on every street corner.

20.verse: Jerusalem says: “Look, LORD, and see to whom you have done this. Women eat their own babies, the children they have cared for. Priests and prophets are killed in the Temple of the Lord.

21.verse: “People young and old lie outside on the ground. My young women and young men have been killed by the sword. You killed them on the day of your anger; you killed them without mercy.

22.verse: “You invited terrors to come against me on every side, as if you were inviting them to a feast. No one escaped or remained alive on the day of the LORD’s anger. My enemy has killed those I cared for and brought up.”

1.verse: The Meaning of Suffering - I am a man who has seen the suffering that comes from the rod of the LORD’s anger.

2.verse: He led me into darkness, not light.

3.verse: He turned his hand against me again and again, all day long.

4.verse: He wore out my flesh and skin and broke my bones.

5.verse: He surrounded me with sadness and attacked me with grief.

6.verse: He made me sit in the dark, like those who have been dead a long time.

7.verse: He shut me in so I could not get out; he put heavy chains on me.

8.verse: I cry out and beg for help, but he ignores my prayer.

9.verse: He blocked my way with a stone wall and led me in the wrong direction.

10.verse: He is like a bear ready to attack me, like a lion in hiding.

11.verse: He led me the wrong way and let me stray and left me without help.

12.verse: He prepared to shoot his bow and made me the target for his arrows.

13.verse: He shot me in the kidneys with the arrows from his bag.

14.verse: I was a joke to all my people, who make fun of me with songs all day long.

15.verse: The LORD filled me with misery; he made me drunk with suffering.

16.verse: He broke my teeth with gravel and trampled me into the dirt.

17.verse: I have no more peace. I have forgotten what happiness is.

18.verse: I said, “My strength is gone, and I have no hope in the LORD.”

19.verse: LORD, remember my suffering and my misery, my sorrow and trouble.

20.verse: Please remember me and think about me.

21.verse: But I have hope when I think of this:

22.verse: The LORD’s love never ends; his mercies never stop.

23.verse: They are new every morning; LORD, your loyalty is great.

24.verse: I say to myself, “The LORD is mine, so I hope in him.”

25.verse: The LORD is good to those who hope in him, to those who seek him.

26.verse: It is good to wait quietly for the LORD to save.

27.verse: It is good for someone to work hard while he is young.

28.verse: He should sit alone and be quiet; the LORD has given him hard work to do.

29.verse: He should bow down to the ground; maybe there is still hope.

30.verse: He should let anyone slap his cheek; he should be filled with shame.

31.verse: The Lord will not reject his people forever.

32.verse: Although he brings sorrow, he also has mercy and great love.

33.verse: He does not like to punish people or make them sad.

34.verse: He sees if any prisoner of the earth is crushed under his feet;

35.verse: he sees if someone is treated unfairly before the Most High God;

36.verse: the Lord sees if someone is cheated in his case in court.

37.verse: Nobody can speak and have it happen unless the Lord commands it.

38.verse: Both bad and good things come by the command of the Most High God.

39.verse: No one should complain when he is punished for his sins.

40.verse: Let us examine and see what we have done and then return to the LORD.

41.verse: Let us lift up our hands and pray from our hearts to God in heaven:

42.verse: “We have sinned and turned against you, and you have not forgiven us.

43.verse: “You wrapped yourself in anger and chased us; you killed us without mercy.

44.verse: You wrapped yourself in a cloud, and no prayer could get through.

45.verse: You made us like scum and trash among the other nations.

46.verse: “All of our enemies open their mouths and speak against us.

47.verse: We have been frightened and fearful, ruined and destroyed.”

48.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, because my people are destroyed.

49.verse: My tears flow continually, without stopping,

50.verse: until the LORD looks down and sees from heaven.

51.verse: I am sad when I see what has happened to all the women of my city.

52.verse: Those who are my enemies for no reason hunted me like a bird.

53.verse: They tried to kill me in a pit; they threw stones at me.

54.verse: Water came up over my head, and I said, “I am going to die.”

55.verse: I called out to you, LORD, from the bottom of the pit.

56.verse: You heard me calling, “Do not close your ears and ignore my gasps and shouts.”

57.verse: You came near when I called to you; you said, “Don’t be afraid.”

58.verse: Lord, you have taken my case and given me back my life.

59.verse: LORD, you have seen how I have been wronged. Now judge my case for me.

60.verse: You have seen how my enemies took revenge on me and made evil plans against me.

61.verse: LORD, you have heard their insults and all their evil plans against me.

62.verse: The words and thoughts of my enemies are against me all the time.

63.verse: Look! In everything they do they make fun of me with songs.

64.verse: Pay them back, LORD, for what they have done.

65.verse: Make them stubborn, and put your curse on them.

66.verse: Chase them in anger, LORD, and destroy them from under your heavens.

1.verse: The Attack on Jerusalem - See how the gold has lost its shine, how the pure gold has dulled! The stones of the Temple are scattered at every street corner.

2.verse: The precious people of Jerusalem were more valuable than gold, but now they are thought of as clay jars made by the hands of a potter.

3.verse: Even wild dogs give their milk to feed their young, but my people are cruel like ostriches in the desert.

4.verse: The babies are so thirsty their tongues stick to the roofs of their mouths. Children beg for bread, but no one gives them any.

5.verse: Those who once ate fine foods are now starving in the streets. People who grew up wearing nice clothes now pick through trash piles.

6.verse: My people have been punished more than Sodom was. Sodom was destroyed suddenly, and no hands reached out to help her.

7.verse: Our princes were purer than snow, and whiter than milk. Their bodies were redder than rubies; they looked like sapphires.

8.verse: But now they are blacker than coal, and no one recognizes them in the streets. Their skin hangs on their bones; it is as dry as wood.

9.verse: Those who were killed in the war were better off than those killed by hunger. They starve in pain and die, because there is no food from the field.

10.verse: With their own hands kind women cook their own children. They became food when my people were destroyed.

11.verse: The LORD turned loose all of his anger; he poured out his strong anger. He set fire to Jerusalem, burning it down to the foundations.

12.verse: Kings of the earth and people of the world could not believe that enemies and foes could enter the gates of Jerusalem.

13.verse: It happened because her prophets sinned and her priests did evil. They killed in the city those who did what was right.

14.verse: They wandered in the streets as if they were blind. They were dirty with blood, so no one would touch their clothes.

15.verse: “Go away! You are unclean,” people shouted at them. “Get away! Get away! Don’t touch us!” So they ran away and wandered. Even the other nations said, “Don’t stay here.”

16.verse: The LORD himself scattered them and did not look after them anymore. No one respects the priests or honors the elders.

17.verse: Also, our eyes grew tired, looking for help that never came. We kept watch from our towers for a nation to save us.

18.verse: Our enemies hunted us, so we could not even walk in the streets. Our end is near. Our time is up. Our end has come.

19.verse: Those who chased us were faster than eagles in the sky. They ran us into the mountains and ambushed us in the desert.

20.verse: The LORD’s appointed king, who was our very breath, was caught in their traps. We had said about him, “We will be protected by him among the nations.”

21.verse: Be happy and glad, people of Edom, you who live in the land of Uz. The cup of God’s anger will come to you; then you will get drunk and go naked.

22.verse: Your punishment is complete, Jerusalem. He will not send you into captivity again. But the LORD will punish the sins of Edom; he will uncover your evil.

1.verse: A Prayer to the Lord - Remember, LORD, what happened to us. Look and see our disgrace.

2.verse: Our land has been turned over to strangers; our houses have been given to foreigners.

3.verse: We are like orphans with no father; our mothers are like widows.

4.verse: We have to buy the water we drink; we must pay for the firewood.

5.verse: Those who chase after us want to catch us by the neck. We are tired and find no rest.

6.verse: We made an agreement with Egypt and with Assyria to get enough food.

7.verse: Our ancestors sinned against you, but they are gone; now we suffer because of their sins.

8.verse: Slaves have become our rulers, and no one can save us from them.

9.verse: We risk our lives to get our food; we face death in the desert.

10.verse: Our skin is hot like an oven; we burn with starvation.

11.verse: The enemy abused the women of Jerusalem and the girls in the cities of Judah.

12.verse: Princes were hung by the hands; they did not respect our elders.

13.verse: The young men ground grain at the mill, and boys stumbled under loads of wood.

14.verse: The elders no longer sit at the city gates; the young men no longer sing.

15.verse: We have no more joy in our hearts; our dancing has turned to sadness.

16.verse: The crown has fallen from our head. How terrible it is because we sinned.

17.verse: Because of this we are afraid, and now our eyes are dim.

18.verse: Mount Zion is empty, and wild dogs wander around it.

19.verse: But you rule forever, LORD. You will be King from now on.

20.verse: Why have you forgotten us for so long? Have you left us forever?

21.verse: Bring us back to you, LORD, and we will return. Make our days as they were before,

22.verse: or have you completely rejected us? Are you so angry with us?
